_prev_prog_3.Description: The prevention program at Zirkle Fruit Co. pretains to all machanical and manual eliments of our process. Safeguards at the facility include Presure relief valves for over pressure. Auto valves as well as manual valves gives the ability to isolate individual zones and main lines.An alarm system which is conected toan auto dialer, diels up to 4 telephone numbers when it scences the presence of ammonia at 16 PPM. There is a person availible at one of these phone numbers 24 hours a day. The machine dials until the call has been answered.

The prevention program at Zirkle Fruit Co. pretains to all machanical and manual elements of our process. Safeguards at the facility include pressure relief valves for over pressure. Auto valves as well as manual valves give the ability to isolate zones and main lines. An alarm system which is connected to an auto dialer, dials upto 4 telephone numbers when it scences the pressence of ammonia at 16 ppm. There is a person availible at one of these numbers 24 hours a day. The machine dials until the call has been answered.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response

Zirkle Fruit Company (ZFC) accidental release prevention policy integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices. ZFC adhere's to all applicable federal and state safety and environmental regulations.



ZFC personnel do not respond to ammonia releases. The emergency plan requires employees to call 9-1-1 and evacuate the plant in the event of an ammonia release.

Anhydrous ammonia is used in a closed looped refrigeration system at ZFC. Chemical properties of ammonia make it necessary to observe certain safety precautions in handling ammonia in order to prevent unnecessary human exposure, reduce the threat to our personnel and reduce the treat to the community.



B. Facility and Regulated Substance Handled

Zirkle Fruit Co. is an apple packing facility. At this site there are cold room as well as controled atmosphere rooms. It is located at 352 Harrison rd. in Selah Washington.

The regulated substance used at Zirkle Fruit co. is anhydrous ammonia (CAS# 7664-41-7). Anhydrous ammonia is used as a refrigerant. 



C. General Accidental Release Prevention Program

Zirkle Fruit Company's accidental release prevention program is based on the following key elements:

*Training of personnel

*Preventative maintenance program

*Use of safety equipment

*Use of accurate and effective standard operating procedures



Zirkle Fruit Company complies with the following regulations:

*OSHA and WISHA process safety management rule

*SARA Title 3 Tire two reporting of Extreamly Hazardous subtances

*EPA CFR 40 part 68

*EPA Risk management Plan 112r under the clean air act



The ammonia refrigeration system was installed to meet or exceed all standards and local codes.Piping and equipment is secured and protected. Other safety system utilized at ZFC include the following:

*Computerized controls, which can be operated remotely

*Suction trap Hi-level float

*High discharge pressure shut down

*Low suction pressur

e shut down

*High dicharge temerature shut down

*Oil pressure failure shut down

*High ampers shut down

*Automatic timer to prevent short cycling (screw machines only)

*Oil filters plugged shut down  (screw machines only)

*250 psi relief valves on high pressure side, to prevent overpressure situations

*150 psi relief valves on low pressure side, to prevent overpressure situations

*Ammoni detection and shut down in all cold rooms.

*Ammoni detection and alarming in engine rooms with ventilation system activation.



Operating procedures and checklists have been prepared to be used by employees performing operational functions. Procedures are kept in the engine rooms and in the safety managers office. These procedures include:

*Initial start-up 

*Normal shut down 

*Emergency shut down

*Routine operations

*Preventative maintenance

*Emergency action plan



A worse case and alternate (more likely) case scenario have been analyzed. The results considered in toxic endpoint of 200-PPM offsite and included the most current census data for the population within the circle created from the release point to the 200-PPM endpoint.



E. Five-Year Accident History

We have had no accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years.



F. Emergency Response Program

Zirkle fruit company has established an emergency action plan for releases involving ammonia as well as other types of emergencies. These procedures instruct personnel to notify 9-1-1 so that public safety agencies and law enforcement will be nitified, and evacuate and account for all personnel (employees, contractors and visitors).



Refrigeration personnel receive annual 8_hour training for ammonia emergencies, Also, the facility does an annual evacuation drill.



Employees at ZFC do not respond to emergencies involving the release of ammonia. Our response is to evacuate or shelter in place and call 9-1-1 for assistance. The refrigeration personnel will assist the fire department on technica

l aspects of the operation.



G. Planned Safety Improvements

ZFC has established a team that include company refrigeration and safety personnel, as well as an outside ammonia ammonia specialist to continual review operating procedures, appropriately address process hazard analysis recommendations and review and update all program elements.

ZFC will continue to conduct preventative mantenance on all equipment to ensure mechanical integrity. ZFC will continue to provide training for refrigeration personnel for the ammonia system, and awareness training for most all other employees.
